subject: Productivity
title: Task Complexity and Goal Types
description: A quick, practical guide to Task Complexity and Goal Types.

hook.text: Outcome goals work for simple tasks. For complex ones, they often backfire spectacularly.

buildup.text: Locke and Latham's fifth principle warns that complex tasks need learning goals, not performance goals.

discovery.text: A learning goal says: discover three strategies. A performance goal says: hit this number. Each suits different tasks.

twist.text: Setting performance goals for novel tasks narrows attention and blocks creative problem-solving.

climax.text: The wisest approach: use learning goals first, then switch to performance goals once you know how.

punchline.text: Learn first. Optimize second. Never reverse that order.

quiz.question: What type of goal works better for complex new tasks?
options: Learning goals that focus on discovering strategies
